intro: Acer dissectum, commonly known as the dissected maple, is a deciduous tree native to eastern Asia. It is characterized by its finely serrated, palmate leaves that turn vibrant shades of red and orange in the fall. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–20 meters and has a rounded crown. Its flowers are small and greenish-yellow, appearing in early spring before the leaves emerge. The bark is smooth and grayish-brown, with shallow vertical ridges.
